6/ could blockchains thus - by modularizing UX and ML layers - ultimately accelerate rate of software evolution? My inclination is yes

{Fin}
5/ if we think back to hardware and Christensen's disruption theory, modularity of hardware was Paramount to accelerate computer performance
4/ blockchains allow us to decouple UI and ML layers from underlying data. Allow for modular competition at each layer of the stack
3/ it's possible this is general-izable - like Google inbox - but is probably better with domain specificty, especially within the confines of slack
2/ I couldn't help but think: if all the underlying data was stored in a blockchain, then diff teams could set different ML models tuned differently

1/ over and over again, people complained about slack. Great tool for being integrated to teams. But too much noise. 

Love/hate relationship
